intro: Tetrastigma pycnanthum, commonly known as the Chinese crossvine, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its tendrils and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, round berry that turns red when mature. Tetrastigma pycnanthum is often used in traditional medicine and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant.
